Shareholder Rights and SEC Policy Glossary ICCR’s Shareholder Exchange Advancing Worker Justice Freedom of Association Paid Sick Leave Workplace Health and Safety Living Wage Corporate Political Responsibility Corporate Lobbying Corporate Political Spending Climate Change and Environmental Justice Climate Finance Climate Lobbying Just Transition to Clean Energy Methane Management Equitable Global Supply Chains Responsible Contracting Prohibiting Import of Forced Labor Goods Worker-Driven Social Responsibility Health Equity Equitable Access to Medicine Nutrition Insecurity Health Equity and Technology Digital Rights and AI Accountability Investor Responsibility ICCR’s Corporate Examiner Member Directory Member Benefits ICCR's Legacy Award Shareholders calling the world’s most powerful corporations Join us! Catalyzing Corporate Change For over five decades, members of ICCR Examples of Our Members’ Impact April 18, 2024 Coca-Cola and Pepsi to Face Shareholder Proposals Citing the Potential Health Harms From Continued Use of Non-Sugar Sweeteners in Diet Drinks Press Releases ICCR Names Pat Zerega as the Recipient of its 2024 Legacy Award Investor Guidance on Responsible Contracting The Non-Sugar Sweetener Debate is NOT Sweet Blog March 26, 2024 Vote Your Proxies – See 2024’s Proxy Memos and Exempt Solicitations ICCR Statement in Response to the SEC’s Rule on Climate-Related Disclosures February 27, 2024 Corporate Influence Over Legislation/Regulation on Key Themes Affecting the Public Interest, Prompts Investors to File Numerous Proposals Scrutinizing Corporate Political Activity Comment Letter from Investors on Pandemic Accord Now Out: ICCR’s 2024 Proxy Resolutions & Voting Guide In Letter to Exxon’s Board, Investors Denounce Lawsuit Against Shareholder Proponents as an Attack on Shareholder Rights January 24, 2024 ICCR Statement in Response to ExxonMobil Lawsuit to Block Shareholder Climate-Related Proposal Other Updates December 14, 2023 2024 Shareholder Proposals at Pharma Companies Cite Strategies to Keep Drug Prices High as Potential Human Rights Risks Shareholders Challenge Major Investment Firms on Declining Voting Records November 30, 2023 Investors Launch Global Network Focused on Workers’ Rights Investors Call on U.S. Companies to Take Steps Toward the Payment of a Living Wage September 21, 2023 ICCR Files Amicus Brief in NAM/NCPPR Lawsuit Against the SEC Joint Investor Letter to Nike on Outstanding Wage Payments A Seat at the Table: Centering Workers to Build a More Inclusive and Equitable Economy, Oct. 5 in NYC August 31, 2023 Investors Push Back on Pharma Lawsuits to Thwart Medicare Negotiated Pricing Investors Ask Members of BRT to Evaluate How their Political Activities May Reinforce or Undermine Democratic Institutions July 31, 2023 CERES and ICCR Urge Board Members to Voice their Dissent with NAM Lawsuit at the SEC June 8, 2023 Shareholders denounce Merck’s lawsuit against HHS as a transparent campaign to protect profits at the expense of patients Investors Appeal to Legislators to Safeguard Workers’ Pensions by Opposing Politically Motivated Threats to ESG Investing ICCR letter to Congress on the reauthorization of the Farm Bill May 30, 2023 Amazon Shareholders See Continued Strong Support for Proposals Raising Concerns Regarding Workers, Climate Change, and the Misuse of Tech Shareholders Register Deep Concerns about Driver Safety at Uber Shareholder Meeting Chevron’s “Racial Equity Audit” Fails to Satisfy Shareholders’ Request April 27, 2023 Worker Justice Rises to the Top of Investors’ Agenda at 2023 Annual Meetings Investors Press Large Asset Managers on their Proxy Voting Records on ESG Proposals Through collective action, ICCR members make both the moral and business case for improved corporate performance on critical ESG risks, pressing corporations to adopt and implement policies and practices that will mitigate business risk and address adverse environmental and social impacts. The Climate Crisis Given the existential threat climate change and pollution pose to the planet, investors expect companies to mitigate their environmental risks. As key corporate stakeholders, investors expect companies to implement policies and practices that support worker welfare. ICCR members advocate for corporate reforms that increase the equitable access and affordability of health care both in the U.S. and abroad. ICCR members press for responsible corporate political activities that align with company values and advance democracy. Global supply chains are in need of a transformation, one that benefits all stakeholders. ICCR Membership Membership in ICCR is open to any institutional investor interested in promoting corporate social responsibility. Learn more about Membership Kyle Cheseborough at kcheseborough@iccr.org Help Us Create the Change We Want to See We can’t do this work alone. Your gift supports corporate engagements and research on a range of critical challenges facing the planet and its people. Our ability to catalyze corporate change depends on your support. Support Us Today Always stay up-to-date. Join Our Mailing List Subscribe to ICCR's eNewsletter "The Corporate Examiner". Name First Email CAPTCHA Mailing Address: 475 Riverside Drive, Suite 1842 info@ICCR.org 212-870-2295 Press Inquiries Follow Us Copyright 2024 EIN: 12-3456789 ICCR Nonprofit Marketing Agency by Elevation Web Terms of Use Privacy Policy Sitemap Notifications

The domain has been registered since 2002 and has a registration expiration date in 2027, which suggests it is not a short-term operation typical of many scam sites. Furthermore, the registrant's email address appears to be associated with the domain, which adds to its legitimacy. There are no immediate red flags here, but I should verify if the organization is known and has an existing reputation.
